description: Building with and on the Earth safely.

slides.title: What is Geo-Engineering?
slides.content:
# Rock & Build üèóÔ∏è

Applying geological science to engineering projects.
- Assessing ground conditions.
- Designing foundations, tunnels, and dams.
- Mitigating geological hazards.

slides.title: Site Investigation
slides.content:
# Look Before Leap üßê

Crucial first step.
- **Drilling**: Taking core samples.
- **Geophysics**: Scanning underground (Radar, Seismic).
- Failure to investigate leads to disaster (Leaning Tower of Pisa).

slides.title: Rock Mechanics
slides.content:
# Stress and Strain ü™®

How rocks deform under load.
- **Intact Rock**: Strength of the stone itself.
- **Rock Mass**: Strength of large block (includes cracks/joints).
- Important for tunnels and mines.

slides.title: Soil Mechanics
slides.content:
# Dirt Math üß±

Soil behaves like a fluid, solid, or particulate.
- **Liquefaction**: Saturated soil turning to liquid during earthquake.
- **Consolidation**: Soil settling under weight (Sinking buildings).

slides.title: Slope Stability
slides.content:
# Don't Slide üìâ

Calculated 'Factor of Safety'.
- Increasing slope angle reduces stability.
- Water is the enemy (Lubricates slip plane).
- Solutions: Retaining walls, drainage, bolts.

slides.title: Stability Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: What is the most common trigger for landslides?

slides.title: Mining Methods
slides.content:
# Digging Deep ‚õèÔ∏è

- **Surface Mining**: Open pit. Removing overburden to get ore.
- **Underground Mining**: Shafts and tunnels. Follows veins.
- **Placer Mining**: Sifting riverbeds (Gold rush).

slides.title: Seismic Surveying
slides.content:
# Sound Pictures üîä

Used to find Oil/Gas.
- Send shockwaves (Truck or Explosive).
- Listen to reflections.
- Maps underground layers in 3D.

slides.title: Groundwater Manage
slides.content:
# Aqua Engineering üíß

- **Extraction**: Wells and pumps.
- **Contamination**: Preventing landfill leaks into aquifer.
- **Subsidence**: Ground sinking due to over-pumping (Venice, Mexico City).

slides.title: Geothermal Energy
slides.content:
# Earth Heat ‚ô®Ô∏è

Using Earth's heat for power.
- Hot water pumped up $\to$ Steam $\to$ Turbine.
- Renewable and constant (Baseload).
- Iceland uses it for almost everything.

slides.title: Tunnelling
slides.content:
# Boring üöá

- **TBM**: Tunnel Boring Machine (Giant drill).
- **NATM**: New Austrian Tunneling Method (Using rock's own stress to support itself).
- Channel Tunnel connects UK and France.

slides.title: Dam Construction
slides.content:
# Holding Water üß±

- **Gravity Dam**: Holds water by sheer weight (Concrete).
- **Arch Dam**: Curvature pushes force into canyon walls (Hoover Dam).
- Requires solid bedrock foundation.

slides.title: Earthquake Engineering
slides.content:
# Quake Proof üè†

- **Base Isolation**: Building sits on rubber pads.
- **Dampers**: Huge pendulums to absorb sway (Taipei 101).
- **Retrofitting**: Adding cross-braces to old buildings.

slides.title: Fracking
slides.content:
# Hydraulic Fracturing ‚õΩ

Injecting fluid at high pressure to crack shale rock and release gas.
- Revolutionized energy.
- Controversial: Can cause small quakes and groundwater pollution.

slides.title: Carbon Sequestration
slides.content:
# Burying CO2 üìâ

Capturing Carbon from factories and pumping it deep underground (into empty oil wells).
- Geo-engineering solution for Climate Change.

slides.title: Land Reclamation
slides.content:
# Making Land üèùÔ∏è

Dredging sand from sea to build new islands.
- Dubai (Palm Islands), Netherlands, Singapore.
- Issues: Coastal erosion and ecosystem damage.

slides.title: Remote Sensing
slides.content:
# Eyes in Space üõ∞Ô∏è

Using satellites (LiDAR, Radar) to monitor ground movement.
- Can detect sinking of millimeters per year.
- Monitors landslide risks.

slides.title: GeoEng Summary
slides.content:
# Recap üìù

- We build **ON** and **IN** the Earth.
- Understanding rocks prevents collapse.
- **Resources** (Mining, Water, Heat) require engineering.
- Balances human needs with safety.
